review_title: Never work here don’t care about employees
job_title: Family Support Worker in North Chicago, IL
pros: None nothing good to say about this company
cons: Run run never work here awful

pros: The pay isn’t awful, but if you have a masters and a license go elsewhere, you have worked too hard and deserve better than to be at this place.
cons: Where do I begin?....my interview was vastly different than my orientation. The environment was, for a lack of better terms, extremely unprofessional and ghetto. It doesn’t matter how much experience, education, or common sense you may have - CLSH favors people that are uneducated and have been there a long time because they are not invested in changing and bettering themselves. I was shocked at how little management there was, the left hand never knew what the right hand was doing. I felt so sorry for the patients that were being admitted there, especially the children. They weren’t going to receive the care they needed. It’s no wonder the place has constantly been under investigation. I’m honestly shocked they can still keep their doors open. It’s not acceptable for incoming patients to overdose in the facility lobby bathroom. So scary. NEVER WORK HERE. They’ll be shut down soon enough as federal funding has been cut. Good riddance.

review_title: Run as far away as you can from this place
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Chicago, IL
pros: Some great staff who truly care about patients, that's really all I can say are the pros at this place
cons: Management don't know what they are doing, disorganized, lazy people get to go shopping and home while on the clock, then management expect you to do that persons work, there's roaches, urine all over the offices, units, patients rooms and assessment rooms. Literally like the previous review this place really needs to be shut down. Management expect you to continue working even when there's urine and feces falling from the ceiling, which is disgusting and horrible to you. I would suggest going to a better company who really cares for you're wellbeing and the patients well being. Parking is also horrible here.

review_title: Valuable experience but serious organizational flaws
pros: Some really awesome, fun, and supportive co-workers; great medical director, great child psychiatrists, awesome program director of children's pavilion
cons: Fundamental organizational issues: terrible and almost non-existent communication,  the left hand never knowing what the right hand is doing, constant cutting corners at the expense of other corners, reactive instead of proactive policies and protocols, abysmal HR dept, terrible follow-through; minimal PTO, very expensive "benefits" like insurance; no matching of 401k

pros: You get paid 27 an hour starting as a new RN. Sometimes, about three months out of year, they offer 500 as reimbursement for school. You learn to work alone. You get lots of experience giving violent patients IMs and handling high energy unpredictable patients
cons: Violent. Got strangled by patient and was on a 30 patient unit with only 1 female staff. Took about 15 minutes for staff from other floors to help. This is because there are no staff. They mostly quit due to danger or are fired for some innocuous reason, but which is due to you complaining about how unsafe this place is

pros: You will work alongside a team that, primarly, is truly there to help others. They are some of the best people I've worked with
cons: Administration is so focused on making money that they no longer care about the safety and well being of their staff and patients. It's really sad to see

pros: Good crew to work with, staff-- including therapists, counselors, secretaries
cons: Too much restructuring at the time
